reviewText:
This is a cute, comfy swimsuit that fits well--at my size (UK 32FF), that's not easy to find, especially not for a reasonable price. I do wish there were more color options, but the black floral, which I ordered, is nice and matches with a wide variety of bottoms.

A couple of notes: The plunge is a bit deeper than I expected from the picture, especially for the very busty among us. I can live with that, but it's good to be aware of beforehand. Thus far I have been impressed with how well the bottom of the tankini stays put while swimming, even on a couple of long tubing trips. This impresses me, as most tankinis I've had have tended to float or ride up while I swam. I LOVE the fact that the built-in bra is well-padded (with padding that stays put), and adjustable, just like a real bra.

I haven't had it long enough to be completely confident of durability, but my Panache bras have been durable, and it feels high-quality. I will try to come back and update after I've had it longer.

UPDATE: After swimming in this all summer and into autumn (I live in Texas), I can confirm that I love it as much as before.

Despite the deep plunge, which sometimes feels like it's catching the water (especially when swimming straight into a current), I haven't had any... ahem... exposure problems. The suit stays put. I have done some SERIOUS swimming in it, including all-day tubing expeditions, and remain impressed with its durability and how well it stays in place. It's cute, and it holds up if you want to actually swim in it, too. Five stars.

reviewText:
I ordered this in a XXL because this is what I normally wear if I want something roomy or if someone suggests a shirt runs small.  In this case I found the XXL to be wider than normal, but a normal length.  I could have gone with just an XL and I am normally very hesitant to do that.  The shirt itself is beautiful and has intricate embroidered flowers along the top front and sides and in the middle front of the shirt.  These are well done and you can tell the difference between these and others that are quickly sewn and not as detailed.  The detail around the neck and arms is another beautiful touch.

I found the shirt to be fairly light weight and it felt very nice to wear on a hot day.  It breaths nicely, although you might need to wear a tank under it depending on how sheer you are comfortable with.  The colors of the flowers are bright and there are a variety of beautiful colors through the embroidery of the s***.  The sleeves flare out a bit at the ends and the feeling and movement of the shirt is nice.  It is cotton, so it does wrinkle, but I didn't find it to be horrible wrinkled as the day went on.

I washed this and dried it on low heat. I didn't see any colors bleeding and the shirt did well in the gentle cycle.  I was very impressed with how well made the shirt is and how comfortable, also. It is one of my favorites and I'm so glad I found it.  It is not nearly as expensive as the detail suggests or as many of the shirts that embroidered in Mexico and by hand.  I would say order the size you would normally wear because it is over-size, especially on top.  Really wonderful shirt!
summary: The shirt itself is beautiful and has intricate embroidered flowers along the top front ...

reviewText:
I bought this for my 10 year old son, he has had the rainbow dash freeze hoodie (actually 2 of them so he had 1 to wear while we washed the other) for about a year now and he never takes it off, I'm certain the school thinks he doesn't even own other clothes, so I thought if I bought the pinkie pie and rarity ones he might change it up a bit.  He says he loves it, school doesn't start back up till next month so I'll have to wait to see if pinkie pie/rarity gets as much rare as rainbow dash.

I know a lot of people have issues with these coats running small, we have not had that issue.  My son is 10, he has the rainbow dash coat in both size 12 and size 14 and he has the pinkie pie and rarity ones in size 16(so he has room to grow and room to layer underneath it in the winter).  He currently wears size 12 slim pants and size 14 shirts, a year ago when I bought him his first rainbow dash coat he was wearing 10 slim pants and size 12 shirts, all 4 hoodies have fit him true to size, exactly like his hoodies from other stores, in the same size, fit.  He is very skinny, and obviously is a boy so he doesn't have the same proportions as a typical 14 year old girl, so that might be part of why we haven't had issues when others have, but they also fit my 12 year old daughter true to size as well.
summary: exactly like his hoodies from other stores

reviewText: If you ever played rugby back in the day, this is the rugger shirt that you wish you could find again.  For most of you this is your grandfather's rugby shirt, or great-grandfather's, the type they then modified for shoulder pads and it became the original football jersey.  Heavyweight knit, triple or quadruple or something, reinforced everywhere with taped seams or reinforcing stitching, like under the arms, rubber buttons, heavyweight cotton canvas collar--this thing will fade long before it wears out, and I don't expect it to fade before 2050 or so.  This is not your nice lightweight summertime long-sleeve polo.  Huge out of the box, shrinks to size after one wash and dry.  It'll soften over time, and become your favorite.  One tip for the manufacturer and buyers: the cuffs are also original heavyweight cotton knit: no spandex or whatever.  If you expect the cuffs to stay shoved up your arms you better have huge forearms.  Wonderful shirt.

I was initially annoyed by this purchase, because the suit I ordered was listed as having a 'built-in soft bra.' The suit I received does not, although it was otherwise the right color and size. I decided against a return, because my water aerobic class started and I desperately needed the suit! I've been wearing it weekly for over a month now, and I really like it despite the no bra issue. It fits snugly enough that my breasts stay put pretty well (I am 5'2" and weigh 185 lbs, and ordered an XL so it would fit snugly. Be sure and follow the measurement guidelines they give in the listing!).

The suit is very well-constructed, the materials are high quality, and it's very comfortable both in and out of the water. Downside? Hard as heck to get out of when it's wet, especially if you go for a snugger fit. I have to struggle to get out of it, or ask for a friend to pull  at the back of the neck to get me started; but I know that this is because I opted for a snug fit.

All in all, I love it, but I still wish it had a built-in bra. When/if I lose some weight and the suit is less snug, I may get a light sports bra to wear with it. For now, it's great.

reviewText:
I ordered this in a small and a medium after reading the reviews about it running too small.  I am 5'6'', 125, with a slender athletic build and a 34B bra size (usually).  I thought that the small may be a good fit because I am not very large chested and do not have much of a backside or a lot of fat on my hips (I'm pretty bony), though I ordered the medium as well just in case.  It turns out that the medium was the better choice.

The bottoms are still a little snug, though secure feeling, and the back of the bottoms definitely shows a little cheek (although I wouldn't say too much as I was going for a sexy look when buying this).  If the bottoms stretch out at all as bathing suits tend to do, I think they will be a great fit.  The smalls definitely were too tight around my hips.

The top of the medium is also secure.  The portion that wraps around the back has a slightly adjustable clasp, although for me it was comfortable on the loosest setting.  The halter part ties around the back of the neck and is very adjustable.  The medium top gives me the cleavage I was looking for without being too uncomfortably tight.  The small top was on the verge of being too tight around my back, and seemed to squish my chest in too much as to not create cleavage.

As a side note, the three straps on the hips do not separate as much as the picture shows; on me it looked more like one solid hip band, but this wasn't the main reason I bought the suit anyway.  I'll be returning the small.

Overall the suit feels very secure and durable.  I bought the white which is flattering on me because I have a tanned skin tone.  I am pretty pleased with the suit given the price at which I purchased it.
summary: Runs small, but overall good quality and secure

reviewText: This has become my favorite swimsuit!!! I wanted a swimsuit that would cover me up without looking boring or silly and this does it. I am a between a size 6 and 8 so I got the medium and it fits wonderfully. This swimsuit fits just like it shows in the photographs, and it looks like you are wearing a cute dress. It is so pretty that I even wear it with shorts or pants on my way to go swimming and it looks like a regular blouse. The outfit is durable, machine washable and it does not loose it's white coloring even when mixed with colored clothing. I even wore this swimsuit to a waterpark and it was strong enough to withstand all the rides and all day use and is not heavy on the body as it dries. I didn't feel exposed like I was in underwear, as I feel in normal two piece swimsuits, and my thighs and rear were not out as with normal one piece swimsuits. I was covered and yet I still felt sexy and trendy because of the cute design and beautiful patterns and coloring. I LOVE this swimsuit and recommend it to everyone!

reviewText: Thin, super flimsy material.  If you have a rock hard body go for it!  This is pretty much lingerie!  The built in bra is basically a tiny bit thicker  - but no real support and your nipples will show.  The slit up the leg means you cant wear any control tops or spanks...which again..if you have a rock hard body...you'lll be fine.  The zipper didn't work, but its so stretchy I was able to pull it over my head.  I'd wear this as lingerie, but thats about it.  I would have paid double the price for decent material.

Sometimes, things just happen to work out. I ordered the last one of these dresses that was available for sale on Amazon. There was no size listed, but it was on sale for $20, so I decided to take a chance. Thanks to Amazon prime, it was delivered to my mailbox at about 9 on a Sunday morning. When I opened the package, I was thrilled to see that the dress was a size medium. I'm sure I could have easily won a large or extra large because of the stretchy fabric, but the medium fits well.
It's a beautiful bright red and a very pretty design. It's actually quite a bit more modest than I expected. The high neckline makes the dress tasteful, and the sheer lace sides and back aren't cut too low.
The slit in the front hits me mid-thigh, which is a bit high for my taste, but it doesn't look trashy. The slit isn't on a seam, so the top of it makes a "u" shape on your leg. I may decide to stitch the slit closed a little bit, but I'll pin it first to make sure that it will lay right.
The material is thin, but it's not see-through, and even though I have lots of lumps and bumps, you can't see them or a pantyline with only the smoothing powers of control top pantyhose. I can also wear my regular nude bra with this dress. No strapless is necessary!
A few negatives besides the slit: the stitching on the sweetheart front is a bit crooked, but my necklace will cover that, and the dress is a tiny bit too short to be worn with much of a heel. A larger size might have been longer, but the medium fits well on my bust and waist.
Considering that I took a chance on a $20 dress with no listed size, I'm pretty happy! It fits, needs no special undergarments to look good on my 44 year old body, and it doesn't need to need to be altered. I'm excited for my husband to see me in this. ;)
summary: Right size and fit outweigh the few minor negatives

This is a big and somewhat "chunky" watch it is 44mm wide without the crown but wears more like a 42mm. It would have been 5 stars but the stem broke and I had to send it back for repairs, which took 2 months on it's trip to and from Hong Kong. The service was good and I knew the whereabouts of the watch through out the process. The watch is an automatic, very accurate (+- 6 secs day) with about a 40 hr reserve. The dial is easy to read and the GMT function works well. The band is a bit stiff at first but fits well. The strap is held on with Screw pins as opposed to spring bars. The Lume is all but non existent and only lasts a very short time.

I like it but the clasp really sucks with this type of bead.  It not only makes it hard to take on and off but it also rolls on the neck and will just fall off.  Got this for my husband who is a chef and it almost fell into the food.  Since I make jewelry I fixed the issue by restringing it and choosing my own clasp, but I really hate beading so yeah that pissed me off.  May I suggest using a crimp bead or some sort of lock spacer in between the bead and the bead and the clasp.  That would prevent rolling if you use a different shape and would allow for some room to grab it and twirl to put it on, making it easier on us.  I love the beads but I could have just purchases a string a beads and done it myself since that's what I had to do to fix the clasp.  Really pretty hematite and my husband loved it since he didn't have to fix it, meeeehhh.  Please go to youtube and get better ideas or test your jewelry on yourself and see what happens.  Thanks.  Would buy again if you changed your technique of the clasp.
summary: I like it but..... fix how you construct your clasp area please.

reviewText: A gift for my grandson, he loved it
My 2.5 yo grandson loved it. He loves to put on his drum and lead everyone on a March wearing his hat!

this hat worked out well for a marching band costume, but i made some changes to better work with my blue and white band uniform.  i used model paint to change the gold medallion to silver, replaced the black feather to white ostrich feathers which were longer and straighter, and added a small silver chain from a hardware store to the bill of the hat.  voila!

the quality and price of the hat are good, but i wished there were other color options; the bill had two dents in it when it arrived but i was able to pop them out.  the material is substantial, stiff and felty, and it took some effort to get a needle through to attach the chain i added. as to size, i have a small head, and it was loose so i tipped it back and it rested on my glasses' temples.  worked just fine.
summary: good costume hat, but wish there were other colors

The material is cotton and thin. The stars are just like you see on the picture, if only they were glow in the dark. It fits well until it hits my thighs. The back pockets aren't deep, but all pockets are usable. Waistband is adjustable. Love how the bottom doesn't flare out so looks good with vans and sandals. I wear these around the house a lot, I just throw on some spandex underneath just because I have to sag them to get enough room in the thighs. Honestly i love these, i would recommend! reviewText: I ordered the largest possible for my sister, but it didn't fit. It was perfect fit for me though, I'm 115 lbs, 5'2", was really disappointed

WOW! This was tiny. I was afraid I was going to rip the top when I was attempting to take it off.

My main complain is about the top.
I'm a 36B, pushing C. I'm also 5'5". Full disclosure, I am not a skinny girl. But since Ryuko has a HUGE bust, I was hoping that there would be more room in the top (since it seems to sort of 'hang' over her chest). My measurements are about the same as the L, so I ordered an XL, because you never know with these companies. One could always alter it if it was too big!
I tried on the skirt first. It took a bit of effort to close the zipper. A bit frustrating.
However, when I put on the top, I was terribly afraid I would have to cut it off. It acted similar to a binder! It absolutely would NOT zip as well. I wouldn't have been able to budge it a centimeter if I wanted. I couldn't breathe properly either. The arms were small as well. . They constricted movement, making it even harder to get off. I was really disappointed!

Otherwise, it's made of very good material, and whoever sewed it did a very good job on quality, despite the tiny size. I would really only recommend this to skinny girls!

*** the return of this cosplay was very fast and easy by the way! Hence the three stars instead of the two I was going to give.
The top was too small for my friend. It didn't fit her. But it's our fault for not looking at the measurements. Great quality overall.

reviewText: She's wearing it today for her birthday.

To be fair, I haven't worn this more than twice so I cannot say how it will hold up over time. So here's what I can say: whenever buying anything coming from Asia, I usually buy a size larger than normal. I debated with this as it's a single suit and not separates. I didn't want it to be too big on the top but I also didn't want it to be too tight on the bottom. I usually wear a medium top (34 D) and medium/large bottoms (hip size 38 inches) in separates so I bought the L in this suit. I have a long torso and short legs and am 5'4". This suit fits really well. The top holds comfortably and is high enough to avoid falling out while playing volleyball or swimming in the waves. Also, the padding in the shelf bra is removable. The skirt hung right below mid thigh (remember-short legs, so I'm sure it'll fall slightly higher for ladies with longer legs). I actually used the halter straps as an a-line belt (tied in the back) on the second day to fix my differing tan lines and it still looked super cute. I got a lot of compliments on this suit and it was very comfortable to wear all day running between the condo and the beach.
summary: Buy to your hip size- halter straps interchangeable

 I love this watch!!

The sunglasses are the real deal. Checked for authenticity. The box it comes in is beautful and has Ray Ban Tech on it. The sunglasses themselves have the engraved RB on the right lense, the pads have the RB on them and it reads right side up when holding the sunglasses upside down. Yes, the ones I got are made in China but that doesnt mean they are fake. Ray Ban are made in Italy and in China.  The accompanying sunglasses case is top quality. There is a distribution seal on the case, that say "100% UV Protection - Ray ban - Sunglasses By Luxottica". The case is also accompanied by a quality cleaning cloth and an information book about the sunglasses. The booklet text is in impeccable language.  Checked the model number that is found on the inside part of the glasses that rests on the temples, looked for both RB and the right model numbers and checked the model numbers off the Ray ban website; everything as it should be. In the hand they feel premuim in weight and texture, built to last and of excellent quality. The rubber components are high in quality and not brittle or hard. It is risky sometimes to buy authentic Ray Ban on the interenet but I can assure you that these are the real deal. Very happy with the purchase!!!"

reviewText: They look like good shoelaces, the only problem with mine is the color. I ordered the sweet orange color, but received bright neon orange laces.

I'd like to mention that the laces you may receive from this company, if you buy 2 colors, may not go together. I ordered some of these orange kind and the Sky blue color, an the sky blue are about an 8th of an inch wider than the orange.  So when i go to checkerboard these they might not look as good as planned since they aren't quite the same size as I was expecting.  Of course, this may be due to the fact that the sky blue were 60Inches long, and the Orange are 45inches. I think you may get the same size is you order the same lengths, but i needed the sky blue to be a bit longer for my straight lace. I was expecting them to be closer to a neon orange, but they are a little darker than that, but they still look great.

Pros:
Quick shipping.
Sweet orange is nice and vibrant.
Sky blue is almost teal like I was looking for.
The company shipping will promptly answer any questions you may have.

Cons:
Different lengths of laces may have different widths. Not ideal for checkerboard lacing.
No idea if the colors you ordered are the ones you were looking for until you get them.
May be slightly wrinkled when you get them because they are kind of just tied loosely together in shipping.

reviewText:
I ordered the night sky painting, which is fun.  Because the print is associated with fine art, it makes this casual skirt a little more elegant.

I have a 30" waist and 40" hips and it fits comfortable at my natural waist, or a few inches lower, at just above my hips (where I normally wear my jeans, at about 35").  The pattern is clear and defined, the fabric is light, silky and flowy and the skirt is comfortable. The underside is white and as you move you can sometimes get a glimpse of the white underside of the fabric.

I was disappointed when I received the skirt because it was over a foot shorter than the product description, which said it is 28.75" long, but it is only 15" long (from the waist band to the hem). I suggest that you whip out a ruler or a tape measure and measure 15" on yourself to see where the hem will reach on you. I am hoping the seller will update the product description to say that the length is 15". The seller contacted me to apologize, and I am now a satisfied customer.

I had originally pictured wearing this to work or the art museum with a nice shirt and a cardigan as I expected it would reach to just above my knee. As it is so short I look like a figure skater about to do an ice skating show!  And as I am no longer a teenager, I do not feel comfortable wearing it as a regular skirt and will only wear it with leggings or very opaque tights.  Good news is that it is adorable over a pair of yoga leggings for CYA coverage! I have received many compliments at dance and yoga class. A few times I ended up running errands with it on and received compliments from strangers (black capri leggings, black flats, blue tank top).

The skirt arrived much more quickly than the estimated delivery date, which was a nice surprise.

Hopes this helps!
summary: Adorable - but very, very short! (much shorter than product description)

reviewText: I can't verify the purchase on my account because my boyfriend bought it for me on his, but he bought me the one with cherry blossom prints, and I love it very much. The material is a very comfortable and silky spandex and polyester mix that is machine washable. We were worried it was a bit short from looking at the pictures and not seeing how long it was in the description, but the elastic band stretches out and it ended up to be the perfect length. The price is very fair for a nice quality skirt and I will consider buying another one in a different design.

reviewText:
I ordered these Yacun Womens vintage large full frame sunglasses in the leopard print for myself.  We boat and fish a lot in the summer, and you can never have too many sunglasses!  (Ok I lose about 20 Pair a summer so maybe it's just me!)

For my normal everyday wear I like smaller frame glasses (just because I feel like a bug with big ones HA), but for my boating and fishing I like the sunglasses that are much larger for the lenses.  These fit the bill perfectly!

The lenses on these sunglasses are rated to block BOTH UVA AND UVB rays.  Many people don't realize you need to be wearing glasses rated to block both of these, but that is imperative to the protection of your eyes!  Extended exposure to UV rays has been linked to several forms of eye damage including macular degeneration and cataracts.  So be sure to cover up those eyes, also don't forget you are getting UV rays from the sun even when it isn't shining bright! ;)

I also love that these sunglasses come with an awesome zip up hard carry case!!! I can hook the case on my shorts, my tackle box, my seat, whatever and pop them in there if I'm putting on my goggles to go swimming!  No scratching or losing these this year!!! (I HOPE haha).  I did receive this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review
summary: Awesome full frame sunglasses!! Blocks all the sun from my eyes and protects from those UV rays!!!

reviewText:
These sunglasses are big on my face and I am not used to wearing big sunglasses, but I like how they fit my face frame. I have an oval shaped face, so not sure how they would look with smaller faces, but if you like bigger frames to cover your eyes then these are perfect. They don't wiggle or move while on and stay where they need to. I was afforded the opportunity to review these at no cost to provide everyone with my honest opinion. I like the leopard theme and the coloring. The frames have UV400 protective coating and blocks the harmful rays from the sun to your eyes. Safety is always best! The sides of the sunglasses are thin, but not weirdly looking thin. It also came with a nice case to protect them when you are not wearing them. The case is strong and is black with white/grey dot pattern. The zipper on it worked as it should and at the end of the zipper it has a clip so that you can clip it on backpack or wherever you want for easy access. It was stitched securely to the case as well. With the style of these sunglasses it looks great in my opinion. I honestly could not find anything negative to say about these sunglasses. I am looking forward to wearing them. I definitely think these sunglasses are fitting with the listed price.

Disclaimer: I received these sunglasses at no cost in exchange to provide you all with my honest and unbiased opinion. All words are my own.
summary: Big frames, but looks good on my oval shaped face

The sidearms have also have the tortoise shell pattern on them and have some elasticity in them. I tried to open them up a bit farther than usual and I had no issues, neither did they come apart. But I would recommend not doing so a lot. The lenses are not polarized but they have a brown tint so they do the job. At this price, these are a steal. It also provides protection against harmful UVA (400) rays. Of course, I haven't tested that claim. I don't know how to. The glasses came in a strong black case including a microfiber cleaning cloth. Overall, I am extremely pleased with the seller and their service and the glasses. I received these under promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a very well made wallet with solid stitching. The grade of leather is really excellent and the zipper is "YKK" which is a solid zipper manufacturer. The wallet has a really nice feel and aesthetically appealing. My only recommendation to Leatherology is that the wallet could be a slightly more rectangular to fit credit cards in more easily in a sideway position. Currently, I have to place the cards in a vertical position. The quality of the wallet is of such a high level that it would last over 20 years with proper care. ( I had a similar wallet that was made by Calvin Klein and this was its lifespan.)

  As for the packaging, Leatherology places the wallet in a luxurious box and further packages in a very distinctive looking packaging. This tells you that the company views their leather products as being extremely unique. The wallet are truly extraordinary and would go well with a suit or fit just as easily with a pair of jeans. The price of the wallet may be expensive to some, but if you are looking for a stylish, luxurious , durable, high-grade leather wallet, then look no further this is the seller to go to for your next wallet. ( I "would give this company "20" stars for this product if I could.)

I waited the said time, waited a little longer than took a paper towel and wiped the white foam off to see....the pen mark still there!! Faded yes, but still visible. I tried it again but it didn't get any better so i tried the unglorified but tried and true way of NAIL POLISH REMOVER. Worked like a charm and i was back in the good graces of a pissed off 9 yr old whos new shoes were not ruined by penmarks. Lol. reviewText:
These Birkenstock sandals are so cute! The blue color together with the black oil is a beautiful blend. The sandals are very lightweight and are quite comfortable with the Birkenstock soft footbed. There is hardly any break in period necessary, perhaps just a few days. It might be best to wear them first inside your home to break them in and have them adjust to your feet.
You may want to try on Birkenstock Arizona sandals at your local store first to make sure you order the right size. Also, if you wear orthotics you'll be able to tell if the shape of the footbed is supportive enough for your feet.
The price on Amazon is awesome!

Loved it!! Good work on this item!

LOVE LOVE LOVE these shoes! They are super comfortable which is important for standing or walking for long periods of time.

My love for these shoes aside, I did some research before deciding and especially important as I've never had Birkenstock soles before. There was a break-in period for the shoes but it did not last time. Additionally, these shoes come in whole sizes and large typically larger than other shoes. For example, I wear sz 8 medium width in a pair of Timberland sandals. However, I sized down in all areas for this pair, going with a size 7 narrow width. This worked out perfectly; I've never been as happy with a pair of sandals as I have with these.

I'm reviewing the second bag I got from this store, first I got the black one and now I got the dark blue one

Both looked and came in great condition, very quick too!
Since I had this bag before I knew what could and could not fit into it. I had to carry my large laptop and a bunch of books for the college semesters and I will say the bag didn't last long, I had to squeeze the laptop in, it made an obvious rectangular shape because of the bags small space. The straps started ripping after carrying heavy stuff in it for so long! I was sad!
But now I got this new bag because I still really like the bags from here a lot and I will say that it's 100% better, there's actually more room than before? Not too much but it is enough to fit my bag without making that weird shape! It also has different bag material it seems, a lot more strong looking and much better reinforced.
The cat paw hanging on the front pocket is also different from the last time I bought it, other time was made of this faux leather now it's made of a soft plastic! Now I don't have to worry about damaging or it falling off!

I'm really happy how much different the two bags were even if I bought it from the same place, both made me really happy and if i were to buy another bag I think I'd come to this store again!!
Lots of my friends loved my bag too and I've gotten a lot of compliments on how it has cat ears haha

Also the side pockets are a lot bigger than last time as well, before it was strictly for phones but now I'm able to fit cans and bottles?! I love it, it doesn't stretch too far but it gets the job done!

- Trina

(do not recomend for carring textbooks) thats how mine tore and i had to sew it back up.

reviewText: Awesome, easy to clean and protects my kids' clothing

These are made in china and have the strangest texture inside the pants. Like rubbery sandpaper. That being said, these are about $10 cheaper than the last pair I bought and they do in fact keep him dry. It is definitely waterproof. My son goes to a Waldorf school in the northwest where they spend LOTS of time outside in rain and mud and he remains perfectly dry. The loops on the bottom by the feet might be useful for some people, but my kid wears his pants over his Bogs boots, so we just cut them off. I bought the size 100 (age 3-4) and it fit my child with room to grow. He is 3 years old and in the 50th percentile for height and weight. They were long, but not so long that he couldn't wear them now. If you're looking for a quality made product with lining, this is not the one to get. If you're looking for a more budget friendly waterproof rain pants (that are actually waterproof) to get your kid through 1 season of rain, then this is perfect. This is our backup pair of rain pants and they work just fine.
summary: It's not as good quality as others, but for the price, it's hard not to like it.

This is more of a size 8 or 6 ... on the outside MAYBE a 10. NOT close to a 12, NOT close to a 14. If it hadn't taken forever to get here, and if it wouldn't cost me so much money to send back, I would definitely send this dress back. The holes (and I'm not a huge arms person) were so tight, it was embarrassing to ask my husband to peel the thing back off of me. It's pretty enough, that for sure, but oh my, just no way that this would fit anyone over a size 8. Just so misrepresented, so badly sized.
summary: GAH when will I learn not to buy Chinese!!!

reviewText: Good
Beautiful piece.

The is a wonderfully unique necklace!

 I purchased the silver color.  Each circle is actually a long piece of wire twisted, some how, into a spring-like flat "coin" and then joined to the next "coin"!  I've never seen anything quite like it!  It feels delicate and light but is well made and strong.

  It catches the light a lot and almost sparkles!  Be warned it is very bright! Something the picture does not show. So if you are more conservative I'd suggest wearing it within your shirt or sweater and let a bit of it peak out.

 It is such a nice piece and could be worn in most any situation and looks very much more expensive than it is.  The length in the picture is fairly accurate and the piece lays comfortably and flat - and weighs just about nothing!

 This is so different and unusual that I'd grab it up as soon as you can!  It's super cute and you won't see everybody else wearing one just like it when you go to the mall  :-)

Decent umbrella for a great price. It is a little flimsy but you can only expect so much from a collapsible umbrella, it's a limitation of its purpose and size. It is compact, stops rain, and is very cute. If you want an umbrella, buy an umbrella. If you want an umbrella that is unique and says something about you, buy this one. If you regularly experience strong wind with rain get a full size umbrella, because this one simply isn't intended for use with high winds. The water activated coloring is pretty cool and I will continue to get umbrellas that feature it. Next up, a rain coat that does the same!!

reviewText: Unbeatable price for product

After reading the reviews posted already I thought the size i purchased would fit just fine. I can barely get the mediums over my hips and it just squeezes everything out all over the place. I was upset because this suit it gorgeous and really wanted to wear it. I will say that the material is great quality and it is definitely made very well. Hoping I can exchange for a larger size. For reference I am 5'9" and about 160-165 pounds. I would recommend size large or xlarge. I received this product at a discount for my honest opinion.

A few other people reviewed this saying that it was tight around the legs. I had a very different problem. How do I NOT get arrested for showing people my nipples with this swimsuit in public?

It fit fine around my leg region. I ordered a large - which is what I would normally order. I tied it as tight as I possibly could around my neck to keep the front/top pulled up, but if I dared to move at all, my boob would pop out. To be fair, I think this is for people with larger breasticles and it isn't the seller's fault I don't have adequate boobage. I wear a 36B right now, I believe. If I filled the cup better, it might stay where I put it.

The material isn't very stretchy but it's sewn well.

I did receive this product for free or at a discount in exchange for an honest review.
summary: It fit fine around my leg region

reviewText:
This bathing suit is very well constructed and comes packaged appropriately. It is 80% polyester and 20% spandex, so it is appropriate to wear as swimwear. The fit is exactly as expected. The design of the suit is very cute, however it is not in the least bit modest if you had any question after viewing the picture associated with the product. While the bottom covers well and the top is designed well enough to stay up, like a string bikini would, the chest coverage is almost non-existent, it seemed to me even more so than the picture depicts. The design with the fringe is actually quite cute and if the chest coverage was better it would easily be a favorite. As is, I would recommend the swimsuit to the very body confident buyers!

I received this suit for free in exchange for my honest opinion.
summary: Unique Style for the Body Confident

Surprisingly high quality; it's well made and breathes well.

I have a bra size of 34A, so I calculated my chest size using the sizing chart on lesloveboat.com because I didn't have a tape measure handy. I fall pretty much in between the medium and large sizes, so I went with a large to be safe (and because most other buyers recommended buying a size or two up). I feel like a medium would have actually been better for me because I'm on the smallest set of hooks of the large and could still stand a little more compression. With a medium, I could use the farthest set of hooks and have a little room for more compression if the binder ever stretches out.

I get a little more compression than a sports bra, but still not completely flat. It'll be fine with loose or bulky shirts, for sure, but maybe not tighter t-shirts or tank tops. You can't get a decent sports bra for this price, though, so for compression purposes it works well.

I wouldn't wear it as a tank on its own, though; the outline of the binder is visible underneath the tank. It's not the most fashionable of tanks, but it's really lightweight and comfortable.

reviewText: So cute

Okay I'm not saying don't buy it, but just know what you're are getting into before you order. Yes these are a pretty good price and all but it's one of those you get what you pay for things. I recently bought one as my first binder and have been wearing for around 3 months. I have stopped wearing this because and would not recommend it to anyone due to the poor fitting, quality, and design. Now I didn't have a problem with it fitting around, its's that the binding part is not long enough to cover my entire chest (As I have a rather large chest) it was obviously made for people with small chests even though I did get one that was two sizes over my actual size. That causes a lot of discomfort and as I have learned could cause actual problems. The material quality is also poor and not very stretchy at all which is one thing binders should always be. Not being stretchy can cause problems with breathing, and other injuries. As for the design please do you're research on binders before buying one. They are not supposed to have binding material all the way around, only in the front. (unless it made to correct back posture which this is definitely not) This is because it binds everything, not just your chest. That will cause a lot of problems with your back, ribs, and shoulders which could lead to injury and tissue damage. I did not realize all of this when buying this product and regret it a lot. So unless you have a small chest and don't plan to wear it often or for long periods of time I highly recommend looking for something of better quality that is safer to wear.
summary: Please be careful when ordering a binder.

reviewText:
For me, this product, after a good 4 months of use, has not caused me any injury so far. The largest size fit perfectly on me, as someone who's around 36 inches in chest measurement, at the first set of buckles closest to the edge. Anyone who wears, approximately a size XL in USA shirt sizes should take caution in buying this.

The way this binder is set up is that there is a binder and the tank seperate, but they are put together at the shoulders, with the binder hanging inside of the tank.

This set up has caused me a bit of trouble, as sometimes things get flipped inside out and it becomes kind of a hassle to put on and constantly rearranging the binder and pulling things inside out and right side up inside of the tank until, (note that there are two shoulder straps, the binder and the shirt), the binder's shoulder strap stops going under my armpit and keeping me caught, and sometimes late to school. However, due to the price, this trouble was just me getting what I paid for. Good deal for good price, as long as you don't have a large ribcage.
summary: Definitely got what I paid for!

reviewText: Perfect (: Size fits true to sizing chart.

Four stars because it completely flattens my chest(my breasts are small but noticable without binder) but the design is flawed because it clasps and hooks on the side, which is very difficult to do if you're new to these types of binders. Now that I've worn it more often I am able to clasp it shut quicker. It's very stretchy yet retains a strong bind. I was very surprised at how flat it got my chest and its not hot or too thick either. Just feels like an amazing sports bra. So glad I purchased. Shipping took forever though lol about 3 weeks.

I purchased a 36-38.  Great fabric, but I will not be purchasing another one since it is not exactly what I want for fit.  There are no manufacturers that make slim fit mercerized solid cotton polos for men for less than $100 USD I guess.  Overall the shirt I am looking for should be tailored, but still drape closely to my body.  I am 6'2", 160 and I exercise regularly so I need a slim fit or it looks like I am wearing a pillowcase or one of those pirate shirts.  Generally the Brooks Brothers slim fit polos work the best for me, but are a bit tight in the arms.

The sweep of this polo was larger than I would prefer at 22 inches.  If I had a 34-36 inch waist that would be fine but it does not look appropriate for my 29-30 inch waist.  Overall the fit is close enough to not be a deal breaker as I will still use it to play golf, but I was hoping the shirt would fit closer to a V framed torso.  If you have a larger waist, then this is a very nice mercerized cotton polo for the warm summer months.
summary: Wish it was a slimmer fit

reviewText: For a child who wears women's M clothes (size 10) we purchased the XXL which was what their measurements indicated.  It fits great (snug) and takes them from a rounded size B to a flattened size A.  The white one posed a problem because they can see the outline of the under "bra" which was slightly visible.  Since child is male on the days he wears this that outline was highly undesirable!  So they have used it under other shirts.  But that is not ideal on hot summer days.  We are waiting for the black one to arrive -- in the same size -- since our expectation is that it will not show an outline of the binder underneath.
summary: Loves it (not in white for males)

reviewText:
This review is for Finn + Emma | Convertible Gown

I purchased this pink one as a baby shower gift, but I have the same one for my baby boy in a different design. Here is the review for that...
Another great Finn + Emma item... I try to cover my baby in as much 100% organic cotton clothes as much as possible. I have a lot of burt's bees and finn + emma. F+E has better material in my opinion and feels sturdier after several washes. (BB thins and wears out a little faster).

This convertible gown is great for babies and I use it for my son as pajamas. He wore the 3-6 months one for months 4 to 5. My baby has always been on the bigger side and this got a little tight for him in the crotch area around month 5 (he was 29in at his month 5 checkup).

Pros:
The gown is convertible so you can either have it footed or open (easier for diaper changes)
Not many front buttons (my baby loved flipping from tummy to back and vice versa so he didn't like clothes with front buttons on it).
Sturdy fabric 100% Organic Cotton
Nice design and color
Fast shipping and great packaging!

Cons:
The head part was always a struggle to put on my son. It was a tight squeeze to get his head through (he was also 95th percentile for his age so it might be his fault ^_^)
Buttons were a little hard to button

Overall, another great product from F+E. Looking forward to new designs and hope they come out with larger sizes.. I purchased this product at a discounted price in return for my testing & evaluation and honest, unbiased review. Like you, I rely on these reviews to select & ultimately purchase a product, so I give my opinion based on personal use. Hope my review helps! (feel free to click "yes" if it has! ^_^)
summary: Super comfy and another great item from F+E

reviewText: These Finn + Emma products never disappoints and this little baby boy romper is no different. I purchased these as a gift for a nephew. I also have a toddler in the same size as the the product which I tried them on her. The romper fit true to size and looked adorable on her even though she is a girl and these are advertised for a boy. The romper features a little pocket on the chest and is very cute. I also like that the Finn + Emma clothing are all tag-less so no itchy tags for your baby. The material is a soft but thick cotton but very well made. Stitching is all in place and very obvious it is a higher end product. This outfit is great for play wear or sleepwear. They have snap buttons along the inseam of the pants and 2 snap buttons on one side of the collar to make putting on and taking off a little easier. This would make a great gift for any baby boy. I received this item at a discounted rate for my honest review.
summary: The romper fit true to size and looked adorable on her even though she is a girl and ...

reviewText:
This is such a lovely little romper/gown. I personally never use gowns for my babies, though I understand why others would like that. This one is super cute both ways, but I will really only use it as a playsuit or romper.

The quality of the fabric is great, and it is SUPER soft. I love putting my kiddos in organic cotton, because I find it is always so much softer than regular cotton.

I really love this brand overall. They make high quality clothing that seems like it will stand the test of time. This little suit will more that likely be kept once baby grows out of it to be a hand me down to friends and family, as I think it will stay in great shape over time.

I would highly recommend this suit and any Finn + Emma products. They are high quality in terms of material and workmanship.

I did receive a discount in exchange for an honest review.
summary: though I understand why others would like that. This one is super cute both ways

reviewText: I purchased this as a baby gift. I really love this brand, it has now become my favorite gift to give at baby showers. I had a coupon code for a couple of items and stocked up for my next few showers. The seams are well done, no stray threads, straight with no pickups. The material is thick and soft. The colors are vibrant the the pattern is modern without taking it out of being suitable for a baby. I highly recommend this stuff.

I received this item quickly and it arrived in protective packaging which kept it unharmed during the process of shipping. I really like the robot style print design of this baby gown and the fact that it is easily convertible to a panted suit. This outfit was made with baby in mind because it's very soft and comfortable. The material is made from organic items which help ensure it won't irritate your baby's skin. The style of this outfit makes it easier to put on a squirmy baby. There are buttons near the collar of the top to widen the neck and snaps along the bottom which convert easily, you just criss cross and snap together the lining of a leg instead of turning it into a gown. This outfit was ordered according to sizing by age and it fits very accurately. I have not tried washing the outfit yet, but I am sure that it should be washed on a gentler cycle. I received this item at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This body suit/sleep sack is adorable. It's organic cotton and so very soft. The pattern is cute little forest creatures on a tan background with orange accents. The greatest part of this outfit is it can be either a sleep sack or a bodysuit depending on how you button it. It looks so adorable on my kiddo. I do believe it runs a little on the large side as I got the size six month and it fit my 15 month old. Just a heads up. Overall, this is such a cute outfit and I'm very pleased with it. I received it at a discounted price in order to review it honestly.
summary: This body suit/sleep sack is adorable. It's organic cotton and so very soft

In fact, appox. 25 million people died in the First World War and the treaties signed by Germany and others on the "losing" side were so restrictive that they caused the conditions that led to the Second World War in which similarly huge numbers of lives were lost. Those who wear this shirt only emphasize the shirt bearers historical laziness.

I'm not interested in having a discussion about this issue. The facts speak for themselves. War is hell, nobody wins. Period.

Color of stone is a medium-lavender, it will go well with many colors of clothing if you're into matching up your jewelry to some degree with your clothing. reviewText: It's a very nice ring especially for the price! I, personally, am not totally in love with it only because the stone is a little larger than I like and it is more pink than purple. Also, I have very sensitive skin so I like that this metal does not make my fingers break out. The band is wide enough to not make my fingers look extra chunky either; it is also very light-weight. The stone setting sits high - I have attached pictures. This is a great alternative to wearing my real diamonds and white gold engagement ring.

reviewText: scratchy lace around neck

I ordered the lilac gown in a size 3X.  It fit well on the initial try on.  I have yet to wear or wash it.  Based upon other reviewers I think I will only cold wash and air dry this one to avoid some of the shrinking that comes with this type of fabric.  Flannel is nice and soft and will probably become more so over time.  Sleeves are open with no cuffs or elastic just a 1/2 inch hem on them.  As others have said, the neckline may be problematic.  It continues to slide down a bit because the shoulder seam doesn't sit up on the shoulder but slightly below it in the front.  This being the case it causes the already wide neckline to fall in a potentially most inconvenient place.  I have some lace I might consider adding around the front of the neckline to help close this up a bit.  I believe that will solve the problem.  This is a really nice gown for the money.
summary: Really nice gown for the money.

Didn't overheat in bed and wore a sweater over it during the day with my comfy wool socks. If I lived in a colder climate, I think I would prefer pajamas though. I bought another of the light denim skirts and a big difference:
1.  Made in China the other in India.

The material is nice as well as the color.  The dots were larger than expected.  They fit well, but there are two things I don't care for, but which I will remedy.  They are high-waisted with elastic around the entire waist, which I find uncomfortable.  I will remove the elastic and make them into lower-waisted scrub-like bottoms.  The legs are way too wide.  Picture a shorter version of elephant pants.  I will take in the seams to make a more tailored fit.  When I'm done, they should be very comfortable and more stylish.  I would consider buying another pair, but not until I have the time to make the adjustments.  Oh, they wash and dry really well.  They came out wrinkle free.

Just lightweight casual shorts with pockets. Full cut. I usually wear a 12, but according to their size chart for my 41" hips I ordered the Large (14-16). Should have ordered a medium.  They come to a bit below the top of the knee.  Fit at waist with a long stride.  I'll wear them for working in the yard, sleeping, and going to the gas station and walking the dog.  Next time I'll get the medium.  Many manufacturers size charts are different.  Pay attention and hope for the best.  I probably could have checked "Fit as Expected", since these, according to their chart, fit like a 14-16 size, which I think they do.  I also bought http://www.amazon.com/Womens-Shorts-Scoop-Pockets-Elastic/dp/B007BP1Y02?ie=UTF8&psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00, size Small! and they fit better.

The material is lightweight -- so you would not be happy with a snug, clingy fit.

reviewText: I haven't bought a pair of Ray Ban RX7031 Light Ray Eyeglasses from Amazon. However, I did purchase this frame from LensCrafters in 2012. I've worn the eyeglasses every day and have never experienced this frame to break (knock on wood). I did buy a Ray Ban frame for sunglasses with the RX7031; it failed, thus is why I'm looking at purchasing another RX7031 (time does take it toll). It is the most comfortable frame I've worn (I'm a young 72). Thanks to the internet we can replace many frames; option is not available from LensCrafters. I recently tested/received a new prescription but was advised by the doctor that I didn't need new eyeglasses because the prescription changed only very slight, and my 4 year old lenses are in perfect condition. I have not babied my eyeglasses but did take care to keep them in a case while not in use. All Pro's for me, except one Con: should I purchase a backup frame while it is available or wait until ... I of course highly recommend the RX7031 frame.
summary: It is the most comfortable frame I've worn (I'm a young 72)

First of all let me state that I am very pleased with the Qiyun necklace set line.  Each one that I have ordered (which has been quite a few)  are well constructed, beautifully made and quite a bargain.  The only problem I have ever had is with this particular purple necklace set (Geometric Oil Drop Silver Chain Tribal Lucky Totem Bib Necklace Earrings Set) which I have ordered twice and both times did not receive what I ordered.  Instead I received Triangle Oil Drop Fringe Charm Bib Choker Necklace Stud Earrings Set.  If this product is not available in this color, It should not be offered.  When I contacted Qiyun, they offered to reimburse me for both necklace sets but I refused as I was keeping them for future gifts.  Bottom line is that I would recommend Qiyun as a company and their jewelry line.

Compression shirts are designed to fit tight, but I didn't want something too tight. So I ordered the large. When I first opened it I couldn't believe how small it looked! Almost like a child's shirt. But then I tried it on. Wow. The material expanded like magic to a perfectly snug fit. The graphics looked as cool as the photo on the product page. I will say that initially, though super soft and flexible, the tight fit took getting used to. But after my workout began, it started to feel like a second skin. Its now my favorite workout shirt.

With brand names I'm always very skeptical of how they will fit some companies make their clothing smaller than others so what you expect is a large disappointment these I have no worries when it comes time to order more. They really are the perfect fit and are true to their size. No need to order larger or smaller just you're regular size. This is your place to go for good quality and cute!

I have three of the Jason Aldean hats all are labeled a 7 1/8. However the first one I purchased I bought in a western store where I was able to try them on first. The next two were purchased on Amazon. I ordered the same size as the first one because I figured it would fit as the first one did. The first one showed up and sat on my head like a thimble. It was over 1/4" smaller compared to the first one when using a fabric measuring tape. I  had a hat stretcher but didn't think I could get one to stretch this far. I contacted the seller and  the manufacturer and neither one ever replied concerning my issue. Three emails were sent to each of them and no response. So I figured I might as well try and stretch it as far as I could. I applied heavy amount of steam and did it a little at a time. I can now at least wear the hat but anything longer than a few hours and I have a headache, so it is seldom worn. Why I bothered buying another one of their products is beyond me, but I did just that. The third hat was this black straw hat. I took it out of the box and placed on my head and the lights went out. I kid you not, it was so large it covered my eyes. These are not expensive hats by any means. I have hats that cost me 10 times what these do, but I don't want to wear them when working on the ranch. Resistol use to make good quality items and they had good customer service, not any longer. Once again three or four emails to the seller and Resistol and never received a reply from either one.  I have used the foam insulation trick but it is just to big for even this to be comfortable. I will never purchase another Resistol product or anything from this seller again. If you are wanting to try one of these hats you better ask yourself a question, Do I feel lucky? Because my friend, you are going to need it.
summary: Poor quality and zero customer service, beware!!!

I purchased this watch from Nissoni jewelers and it was a faulty defective product as I unpacked it. Nissoni never mentioned warranty anywhere inside the package or on the invoice. I emailed Belair and informed them the watch was faulty and defective and the reply was to send it to the Belair Service center. I also informed Nissoni Jewelers of the problem. The cost of using the Belair warranty is $30, postage both ways and a money order. I now consider my new watch as used and repaired, and the quality of the watch and the integrity of the Belair company is not anywhere near Swiss quality. I cannot recommend a company or jeweler who sells defective products and expects the consumer to pay for this lack of quality control in the products they sell.
summary: Beware of faulty defective products from the Belair Company

I'm a pretty solid US size 10, and these fit just right - snug enough to stay on, but not too tight, and there wasn't any uncomfortable pinching on the achilles tendon like I've had with some other heels so I was thrilled with that. While I didn't blister (sweeeeet), my feet were giving me hell by the end of the night (about 5 hours of constant standing and moving around for bridesmaid stuff) - that could just be because I work from home now and only wear heels a few times a year though. I'll definitely be wearing them out again - they look fantastic with skinny jeans - and I'll try to break them in, so I'll update this review if anything changes.

All in all, I would highly recommend these shoes. The price is right, and the shine is just enough, but not so much as to be gaudy. I was happy with the fit and feel, and had I not been prancing and dancing around on extremely hard floors with feet that had grown accustomed to flats, I'm not even sure there would have been any discomfort at all. Love them, and I would buy them again (and yes, I did get compliments on them).
summary: Sexy and Relatively Comfortable - Would Definitely Recommend

I am feeling a bit 'meh' about this dress. First off, I LOVE the price, of course. I am thrilled that I can get pretty decent clothes for a good price.

This dress took about a month to arrive after I ordered it. I ordered it to wear to a wedding I'm going to, and it arrived the day before I am to leave for my trip. I guess that would have been perfect timing had the dress fit properly...

I am 5'5", weigh 135 pounds, have a tiny waist and 32DDD bra. Wide hips. I ordered this dress in medium. When I received the dress, I was excited because the quality seemed just fine at first glance. The fabric is soft and cotton-y, but somewhat sheer so that in bright light, you can see through the fabric and the outline of the legs is obvious. Otherwise it is opaque enough to wear without a slip underneath as long as your undergarments are nude and match your skin.

The dress is shorter than what I expected. It hits right at the top of my ugly knees. I always get dresses that are just long enough to hide my knees because I hate them, lol! So that was sad that it was shorter. The top is also much higher than how it looks in the photo. Or maybe just on me it seems higher. At any rate, the picture makes it look cleavage baring and sexy, but in real life it's not. It hides all my cleavage. Not sexy enough to wear around Vegas. Maybe I need a super duper push up bra for that effect ;)

Also, on me, with my smaller than average waist, there is a lot of fabric bagging and sagging on my lower back above my butt. It's just a lot of loose fabric that hangs there and makes me look really dumpy. From the front view, it's cute and fits well. From the side/back, the sagging droopy fabric in that one area annoys me. I will definitely need to spend some time altering this dress to fit my body perfectly.

If you're around my stats but have a nice bubble butt to fill the loose fabric and good looking knees, this dress would probably fit you well. It is stretchy and comfortable. Very cute, over all. I'm just bummed that it wasn't perfect off the rack, haha!

I will most likely order from them again and simply alter the garments to fit my measurements.
summary: Electric Blue Color Block Pencil Shift Dress (Black with blue section down the front)

reviewText: This little bag is perfect for what I was looking for. I am an artist and I sell many of my paintings at local art & craft shows. reviewText: Cheap material.
Sizes is bigger than normal

This is my first jacket in the long, stadium style, and I am appreciating the extra length in this zero temperature weather...I'm learning to remember to tug the jacket up before getting into the car, or I get choked upon sitting down.
The jacket is a bit of larger in the chest and waist area than I expected, for a size 2X. I think you could fit a quilted vest under it if you wanted. I have long arms, so it seems no matter what women's coat I buy, the sleeves end up short for me. I find this jacket to be tight in the upper arms, so multiple layers get a little tight there.

Best features:
- High collar, made of a thick, sweater like material that is good for hiding behind when the wind gets nasty, and you forget your scarf. This material is also around the cuffs, so wind can't sneak up your arm. Nice details.
- Zipper that has two pulls, so you can unzip the bottom, for a little extra stride room.
- Good sized flap with snaps that covers the zipper. This is good for keeping the wind out, and for buttoning up quick when you're in a hurry.

Not so great features:
- POCKETS. Disappointing pocket situation, for all the thought put into other features. Just two outside pockets, and they are chop pockets. I can fit my thin glove and my keys in one pocket, but it's not ideal, and it bulges out rather awfully. Yes, they do have zippers on them, but that's kind of scratchy when reaching in and out. No inside pockets. (I will admit that this is a general beef I have with A LOT of women's clothing. Get it together women's clothing industry.) Most people have a phone, and carrying it in a shallow chop pocket, with a zipper, is a good way for it to fall out when you bend over or sit, and scratch it on the way out. I know ladies have purses, but if you're already wearing a parka, in a blizzard, how much stuff do you want to juggle? (Rant over, sorry.)
- It is not the most flattering of silhouettes, especially with gloves in your pockets (I couldn't help myself), but this is more of a necessity coat than a fashion statement.

This is not a coat for spending long periods of time in cold weather, but for walking the dog around the block, the walk into and out of work and the grocery store, it serves its purpose. For the price, I think this is a good deal.
summary: Get it to stay warm, not for storage capacity

reviewText: I freely admit that the first time i purchased this coat i picked the size i thought i needed and ignored the posted size chart.  I usually ignore the size charts so this was my lesson to learn.  Size charts are there for a reason and can be very helpful when ordering from a company for the first time so duly noted.  That said, this coat is BIG.  So big in fact that it feels like you're wearing a tent.  I returned the first coat, consulted the size chart, realized the error of my ways and ordered another that was two sizes smaller than my original purchase.  It came today and guess what...STILL A TENT.  I'm not a small woman, in fact the first coat i ordered in a 1X because i wanted a comfortable fit with some room for thicker sweaters or layers and i thought that 1X would give me that.  I'm disappointed because i had high hopes for this coat to be my go-to choice in the closet but the second one is already boxed up and on its way back and i will not be ordering a third.  My other issue is less important and it's with the color.  I purchased the navy and it's a really dull and frumpy navy blue.  Could be the size issue affecting my overall opinion of the color but i just realized i didn't like anything about this coat enough to continue to play the what size should i really get game anymore.  My advice to anyone considering this coat, it looks NOTHING like the picture with the model wearing it with her cute little sweater and jeans.  The coat has no form or shape to it. No darts in the back to flatter the figure it just hangs.  On the plus side, It does seem kind of warm and if you could solve the size mystery seems like it would be a really comfortable weekend coat.  So if roominess takes priority over style then this coat will definitely give you the room.  Just don't be like me and ignore the size chart.
summary: Buyers Beware You're Buying a Tent...

Iron fist has the best wallets!

This wallet is amazing! I've only had it for a day but I got it to replace my Iron Fist Over the Rainbow wallet (http://smile.amazon.com/Iron-Fist-Rainbow-Bifold-Wallet/dp/B00EE47BK0/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1437006404&sr=8-3&keywords=iron+fist+over+the+rainbow&pebp=1437006407979&perid=1T4GFF09A7YDBGFCYHPP) which has faithfully served me for two years but from days upon days of shoving it into my purse, has sustained bow damage and strap damage. This wallet has less embellishment on the front, so it's slimmer. And me, a self-professed card-and-movie-ticket hoarder, absolutely loves the space of Iron Fist wallets across the board. They all have basically identical interior card arrangement and no shortage of hidden pockets and slots. The ONLY complaint I have is the ID card window. it does NOT have a thumb hole, you know how there's usually a hole in the middle of the plastic window so you can put your thumb (or other preferred finger) there to shove the card up and out of the slot? none of the wallets seem to have that. no matter though, I simply fixed it by cutting one with an Exacto knife. paired with the Iron Fist Muerta Punk black and pink purse that has been out of production for years (I managed to hunt down a NWT one on eBay that someone has obviously bought and shoved into their closet), my accessories are a knockout. I highly recommend all Iron Fist products. they hold up well, even to the roughest and toughest of purse carriers (me, basically).
summary: Iron Fist everything. Great products. Specifically this wallet. A+

Into the top. The top fit fine around the band, but the cup was so small and padded that it looks like I have a second layer of boobs growing out of the top! I tried adjusting it a few times, but no matter what, it just wasn't going to fit. I wouldn't have been so bummed about this if it wasn't for the fact that they didn't have the same color in size XL. I guess I'll just have to find another brand similar, and hope I'll have better luck with the top. Basically, if you're bigger than a C cup, I recommend going a size larger, or just skipping the bikini style altogether.

Not pretty.  But, the difference between before and after using compression socks every day is amazing.  No more fluids.  My legs feel much better.  And, yes, even look better.  Even the petechiae is fading.

I have purchased Gold Toe socks for many years  However, I wasn't aware that they made compression socks so I ordered a different brand.  It's ok, but certainly not as good as the Gold Toe version.  I do have to warn you, they're a pain to put on and not much better to take off.  But, bottom line, it's worth it!  I bought the white socks and I love them.

One other thing.  If you find that your feet are rough or your toe nails have a tendency to catch on the socks (an old man problem) put on a pair of ankle length socks first.  Gold Toe makes a great version and you can get them in multiple sizes.  It will make putting on the compression socks much easier and it doesn't feel like you have two sets of socks on.  I'm sorry if this was more information than you wanted!
summary: Love my compression socks and so do my legs!

reviewText: This wallet felt really nice.  Leather was very soft and smooth.  The problem with it is that it was far too bulky.  They use padding (at least it seems like it, I would not had been able to verify unless I had cut it open) on each side of it that makes it really fat.  The zipper was also very cheap quality.  The zipper especially caused problems when the wallet was full.  It was almost impossible to close.  I filled it up with exactly what it was capable of holding and no more.  That is, a card in every card slot and a couple of dollars in the money pouch.  Once full, I could not close the wallet.  The removable insert was truly a disappointment as well.  The pictures of it (both on Amazon and on the manufacturer's website) show that it can be comfortably folded in half (and stay that way) and used as a separate wallet.  It does not fold in half "willingly"  That is, it will not stay folded in half as the center of it is too think to fold easily; it bulges (even when it was completely empty).

This wallet is really great! Although, I get teased by my guy friends that it looks gay, I simply couldn't care less of their opinion because function and quality outweigh the teasing by far!

To those that complain that the take out wallet or any part of the wallet doesn't fit the cards, I simply disagree. The pocket sizes are perfect for all my cards.

The only warning I'll tell others is that with the take out wallet--you really need to keep the amount you stuff in to a minimum if you want to be able to fold it and it stay closed. However, I can easily fit 4 cards and 10-15 bills and it stay shut. Which is exactly what the take out portion of the wallet is suppose to be for.

I really love this wallet and feel the need to stop shopping for a better one as this one seems to be the best.

I love this wallet and I've tried many others. This is the best wallet I've found by far.
summary: Best Wallet in the World! No Kidding!!!

I gave a pair of Lazy One pajamas to all seven of my sister's grandchildren for Christmas and everybody loves them.  They are well-made,  comfortable, sport nice bright colors, wash well without too much shrinkage, and have adorable & humorous themes.  Each grandchild got a different theme and all of them were a hit.  There are themes for both girls and boys, as well as themes that I'd call gender neutral (good for hand-me-downs!)  Lazy One also makes PJ's in junior sizes for teen girls and also in men's & women's sizes.  I gave a "Huckle-Berry" set to my sister for her BD and I'm wearing this "Out Cold" set right now.  I love them.  The bottoms, which I had to buy separately because this theme is from a past season and wasn't available as a set, have pairs of friendly-looking penguins strolling around.  I also gave a set to my 20-yo daughter for Christmas and she was very pleased.  Her set features parent & baby polar bears and the phrase is "Too Cool".  Another available set shows a cute cartoon horse wearing boots, the top for which says "I Need My Booty Sleep".  Plenty more themes are available.
summary: Quality PJ's with clever cartoon themes - sure to please

reviewText: Nice size for a wallet and sturdy construction

Well designed and constructed. Cards go in sideways so they are more evenly distributed and the wallet stays flat. This wallet is dimensionally larger than "traditional" wallets, and it seems a bit strange at first, but you'll overcome that quickly. The sailcloth material is stiff but soon conforms to the curve of your butt. I used to have pain from sitting on my old "ball" wallet; no more with the RE Hipster wallet - it really does save your ass.

The price is steep, but it looks likes this thing is super-durable and built to last a lifetime. Just get it.

UPDATE: I bought the RaggedEdge luggage tag to hold the RFID prox card I use to open doors at work. This got me thinking about the alleged RFID blocking capabilities of this wallet. I put the prox card in the wallet and placed it next to a reader: The door opened! While this test was decidedly unscientific, it leads me to believe that the RFID blocking claim is false. So, unless the manufacturer cares to call my test bogus, I must drop a star from the wallet review.

reviewText:
I ended up getting two diff styles of pants. I ordered 4 pairs of pants total, 2 being size 32, the other 2 were size 34. The size 32 were one style and the 34's were another. As you pick your diff sizes the picture will change. One style was way to tight in the legs and crotch but loose in the waist if you can picture that. Both pairs of these style ripped so fast, Like 1st or second time worn fast. Throwing my leg over my bike ripped the crotch of one pair. They suck and I should have returned them. The other style of pants are really cool, I like them a bunch. The material is really thin and low quality tho. One pair of those has a rip in them already too.

All in all I would stay away from this product. You don't really know what you're getting till you get it. Is it gonna be this style or that one? One style is uncomfortable and will rip easy. The other style's rad as hell, very comfortable but will rip easy. They both are very poor quality and are worth no more than 10-15 dollars at best. 3 out of 4 pairs ripped very early on in their life. I didn't get to wear any of them more than 4-5 times.
summary: Two diff styles/ rip easy/ uncomfortable/ way over priced for what you're getting as far as quality goes. Do not buy.

reviewText:
I saw the other review for these shoes and so I ordered a size 10 (I normally wear a size 9.5).  The shoes are still way too small - the 10 feels like a 9.  However, I want to say that the shoes are very well made and have padded insoles and great no-slip tread.  I liked them so much I decided to try ordering them in an 11.  I'm waiting to see if that does the trick.  My recommendation: order 1.5 sizes up!

UPDATE: I got the size 11 and they fit, although still a little snug (meaning my big toe bumps against the top of the shoe).  It's a good enough fit for me, so I'm keeping them.  Just be aware when ordering these that if they don't fit, you're looking at spending at least $9 to send them back!
summary: Beautiful, well-made shoes, but order 1.5 sizes up!

reviewText: These are great pants. they are authentic & they got delivered in 5 days. I think they fit perfect! They don't make noise when you walk but when I sit down they do. I'm 5'9 and they go all the way down to the bottom of my ankle.

The dress is beautiful. The bodice is corseted and comes with silk tie. It fits perfectly on my daughter, who is 5'3", it falls to just above her knees.  My only complaint is that there is no modesty panel in back so skin can be seen through corset holes, but we figured out how to cover with undergarments (long line strapless bra and she is throwing on a pair of white shorts). We watched a video on you tube for how to properly lace the dress, which was very helpful, especially in keeping the ties flat when cinching it up. Dress bought for homecoming dance, coming up in October, it should look great. We also bought a thin sweater to cover her shoulders, etc. although school has approved of dress. Very happy with purchase.

Bought for my sister for prom. It looked as pictured, maybe a little more red than pink. We took her measurements and they were exactly the same as the 24w. When we got the dress, (took a couple weeks to ship, probably due to the dress having to be made, fast shipping once it shipped), it was a little too big in the bust area and waist. Which was easily altered by a family friend. Also the detailing on the bust looked a little odd up close, there are U shapes that look like they would go underneath to frame your bust  but they just sat on top. OVERALL it is a decent dress, my sister loved it and had a great time in it. Personally I would not order a dress online again due to not being able to try it on and find that dress with the perfect fit that flatters your body.
summary: Well made, good price for one time wear

reviewText: These run a approximately 1.5 size smaller, due TO THE FACT that they are made by Asians FOR Asians. If you or a loved one that might be wearing these SHORT PANTS stand over six feet tall these are not for you. The item was exactly as pictured and described and the company shipped it very quickly. However, with that being said - the sizes aren't even close. When I emailed them about the size difference, they said their sizes were correct. They also provided sizes in the response email stating that the XXL was suitable for a waist of 78cm (which converts to 30 inches). The size chart provided BEFORE we purchased said that XXL was suitable for over 40" waists.  Not even close! And they want me to pay the shipping back to China - no way! I'm better to just sell these at a yardsale!
